headline: Paramount Stock Jumps After Earnings, as Warner Weighs Its Offer
summary: Shares in Paramount Skydance rallied about 10% after the entertainment and media company‚Äîwhich is pursuing a bid for rival media company Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äî reported earnings.  Revenue for the direct-to-consumer segment, which includes the Paramount+ streaming service, rose 10% in the fourth quarter.  Its TV segment was weaker, with Paramount flagging more difficulty ahead as pay-TV subscribers decline.

content.title: Paramount Stock Jumps After Earnings, as Warner Weighs Its Offer
content.summary: Shares in Paramount Skydance rallied about 10% after the entertainment and media company‚Äîwhich is pursuing a bid for rival media company Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äî reported earnings.  Revenue for the direct-to-consumer segment, which includes the Paramount+ streaming service, rose 10% in the fourth quarter.  Its TV segment was weaker, with Paramount flagging more difficulty ahead as pay-TV subscribers decline.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Weighs Paramount Bid Against Netflix Deal Narrative
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery (NasdaqGS:WBD) is reviewing an improved takeover bid from Paramount that its board says could qualify as a Company Superior Proposal versus its existing Netflix agreement. The board is consulting advisors and has given Netflix a set window to match Paramount's enhanced offer, creating a live bidding contest between two major media groups. This review process marks a key point for Warner Bros. Discovery's future ownership structure and could influence how its content...

headline: Warner Bros says Paramount bid superior, countdown begins for Netflix response
summary: Feb 26 () - Warner Bros Discovery said Paramount's revised $31-a-share offer was superior to its existing deal with Netflix, giving the streaming giant four business days to respond or walk away from the bidding war for ‚Äåthe coveted Hollywood studio. The high-stakes battle could be in its final stretch after the announcement on Thursday.

content.title: Warner Bros says Paramount bid superior, countdown begins for Netflix response
content.summary: Feb 26 () - Warner Bros Discovery said Paramount's revised $31-a-share offer was superior to its existing deal with Netflix, giving the streaming giant four business days to respond or walk away from the bidding war for ‚Äåthe coveted Hollywood studio. The high-stakes battle could be in its final stretch after the announcement on Thursday.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery deems Paramount's takeover bid superior to Netflix deal
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has determined that Paramount‚Äôs latest takeover offer is better than the streaming and studio deal it struck with Netflix, marking a stark shift in momentum in the fight for the storied Hollywood giant.  The owner of HBO Max, DC Studios and popular titles like ‚ÄúHarry Potter‚Äù had previously backed Netflix‚Äôs proposal for months.  Netflix now has four business days to try and match Paramount‚Äôs proposal to further revise its offer ‚Äî which currently stands at $27.75 per share for Warner‚Äôs studio and streaming business.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery deems Paramount's takeover bid superior to Netflix deal
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has determined that Paramount‚Äôs latest takeover offer is better than the streaming and studio deal it struck with Netflix, marking a stark shift in momentum in the fight for the storied Hollywood giant.  The owner of HBO Max, DC Studios and popular titles like ‚ÄúHarry Potter‚Äù had previously backed Netflix‚Äôs proposal for months.  Netflix now has four business days to try and match Paramount‚Äôs proposal to further revise its offer ‚Äî which currently stands at $27.75 per share for Warner‚Äôs studio and streaming business.

headline: PARAMOUNT COMMENTS ON WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY BOARD'S DETERMINATION OF PARAMOUNT'S PROPOSAL AS SUPERIOR
summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") confirms that it has been notified by Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") that WBD's Board of Directors has determined that Paramount's $31 per share, all-cash proposal to acquire WBD is a "Company Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX).

content.title: PARAMOUNT COMMENTS ON WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY BOARD'S DETERMINATION OF PARAMOUNT'S PROPOSAL AS SUPERIOR

(NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") that WBD's Board of Directors has determined that Paramount's $31 per share, all-cash proposal to acquire WBD is a "Company Superior Proposal" under the terms of WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NFLX).

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors Determines Revised Proposal from Paramount Skydance Constitutes a "Company Superior Proposal"
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board"), following consultation with its independent financial and legal advisors, has determined that the previously disclosed proposal from Paramount Skydance Corporation ("PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) constitutes a "Company Superior Proposal" as defined in WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. ("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX).

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors Determines Revised Proposal from Paramount Skydance Constitutes a "Company Superior Proposal"
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. ("WBD") (NASDAQ: WBD) today announced that its Board of Directors (the "Board"), following consultation with its independent financial and legal advisors, has determined that the previously disclosed proposal from Paramount Skydance Corporation ("PSKY") (NASDAQ: PSKY) constitutes a "Company Superior Proposal" as defined in WBD's merger agreement with Netflix, Inc. ("Netflix") (NASDAQ: NFLX).
